Free Online Bridge is a great way to play the classic card game of bridge online. It’s easy to learn, but difficult to master, making it a perfect game for players of all skill levels.

The goal of the game is to win points by taking tricks. A trick is a round of play where each player plays one card. The highest card of the suit led wins the trick, unless trump is played. Trump cards are the highest-ranking cards in the game, and they can beat any card of another suit.

The game is played with a partner against two opponents. The four players are seated around a table, and the dealer deals out 13 cards to each player. The remaining card is placed face down in the center of the table. This card is called the kitty, and it’s used to determine the trump suit.

The game begins with bidding. During bidding, players try to guess how many tricks they can win. The player who wins the bid becomes the declarer. The declarer and their partner must then try to win at least as many tricks as they bid.

Once the bidding is over, the game begins. The declarer leads the first trick. The other players must follow suit if they can. If they can’t follow suit, they can play any card they want. The highest card of the suit led wins the trick.

The game continues until all 13 tricks have been played. The team with the most tricks wins the game.

How to Play Bridge

  1. Deal the cards: The dealer deals 13 cards to each player, one at a time. The remaining card is placed face down in the center of the table. This card is called the kitty, and it’s used to determine the trump suit.
  2. Bidding: During bidding, players try to guess how many tricks they can win. The highest bid wins, and the player who made the bid becomes the declarer.
  3. Play: The declarer’s partner, called the dummy, places all of their cards face up on the table. The declarer then leads the first trick. The other players must follow suit if they can. If they can’t follow suit, they can play any card they want. The highest card of the suit led wins the trick.
  4. Scoring: The team that wins the most tricks scores points. The number of points awarded depends on the contract, which is the number of tricks that the declarer bid.

Basic Bidding Rules

  • The first bid must be at least one.
  • Bids must be higher than the previous bid.
  • Bids can be in a suit or notrump.
  • Notrump is the highest-ranking denomination, outranking all suits.

Basic Playing Rules

  • The declarer must win at least as many tricks as they bid.
  • If the declarer wins more tricks than they bid, they score bonus points.
  • If the declarer fails to win at least as many tricks as they bid, they are penalized.

Tips for Beginners

  • Start by learning the basic bidding and playing rules.
  • Once you know the basics, you can start to learn more advanced strategies.
  • Don’t be afraid to ask for help from more experienced players.
  • There are many resources available online and in libraries to help you learn bridge.
